name: py-httpstan

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: HTTP-based REST interface to Stan, a package for Bayesian inference.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-aiohttp
dependencies.description:
Supports both client and server side of HTTP protocol. Supports both
client and server Web-Sockets out-of-the-box and avoids Callbacks.
Provides Web-server with middlewares and plugable routing.

dependencies.name: py-appdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir".

dependencies.name: py-webargs
dependencies.description:
Python library for parsing and validating HTTP request objects, with
built-in support for popular web frameworks, including Flask, Django,
Bottle, Tornado, Pyramid, Falcon, and aiohttp.

dependencies.name: py-marshmallow
dependencies.description:
marshmallow is an ORM/ODM/framework-agnostic library for converting
complex datatypes, such as objects, to and from native Python datatypes.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependent_to.name: py-pystan
dependent_to.description: PyStan is a Python interface to Stan, a package for Bayesian inference.
